definition: texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up

sentences.english: The text is a sane conversation with millions of participants.
sentences.chinese: 文本是一次與無數參與者的理智交談。

sentences.english: Nebuchadnezzar returned to his right mind only after he looked up to heaven.
sentences.chinese: 尼布甲尼撒舉目望天之後才恢復了理智。

sentences.english: Those misfortunes almost deprived him of his reason.
sentences.chinese: 那些不幸事件幾乎使他失去理智。

sentences.english: They came up with several designs for giant arks of sanity.
sentences.chinese: 他們理智地想出幾個特大方舟的設計。

sentences.english: His mature compositions are generally considered the more cerebral and crabbed .
sentences.chinese: 他成熟的作品一般被認爲是觸動理智的和難於理解的。

sentences.english: Their ectoplasmic humour often overwhelms their sense of reason.
sentences.chinese: 他們的理智經常受到靈外質的侵蝕。

sentences.english: Feelings often stand in the way of forgiveness, veiling judgment and common sense.
sentences.chinese: 情緒總是會影響判斷和理智，從而阻礙寬恕的發生。

sentences.english: It avoids the intellectualism of christian theology .
sentences.chinese: 它迴避宗教神學的唯理智論。

sentences.english: But don't over-intellectualize your emotional reaction. Instead, get out of your head and trust your instincts.
sentences.chinese: 不要不要對自己的情感過於理智，相信你的直覺。

sentences.english: Lyla, you're losing it. You're right.
sentences.chinese: 你有點失去理智了你說得對。

sentences.english: It is usually added that understanding must not go too far.
sentences.chinese: 再則，也常有人說，理智不可太趨於極端。

sentences.english: My world is silent silent, cannot hold others.
sentences.chinese: 陷入情網的人是無法理智的。

sentences.english: You have boring, and rational, and precised leaders.
sentences.chinese: 也有嚴肅乏味理智冷靜，但又精確全面的領導者。

sentences.english: One should look at executive bonus with a slightly dispassionate approach.
sentences.chinese: 大家應該稍微冷靜冷靜，理智看待高管獎金這事。

sentences.english: Maybe, it's just because of you.
sentences.chinese: 還是你的理智淹沒了我的善感。

sentences.english: Don't lose your reason however excited you are.
sentences.chinese: 無論你多麼興奮都不要喪失理智。

definition: to act impetuously (idiom); on an impulse
to have an urge/to be impetuous/impulse/urge
to let emotions affect one's decisions
lit. to be muddled in the brain (idiom); fig. excited and unable to act rationally/to go to one's head
